page.title: 12The Headmaster - 1
page.content: {Mr. Russell}has only ten teachers for his 340 pupils, this is not enough! He would like several more, but in the present financial circumstances, he won't get them. It would be particularly beneficial for the{Infant's Reception}classes to be limited to twenty, so that children might at least get a good start. Mr. Russell thought that teachers should be paid more as theirs is such a very responsible job and currently teachers have been left behind in their comparative pay levels. Mr. Russell fears that there are now more children who are badly behaved, but most children are still good and work hard! Some people blame tele- vision programmes for bad behaviour; for example, children see kicking and other violence and copy bad examples.
